intro: Palicourea subalata, commonly known as the silverleaf palicourea, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, woody stems and lance-shaped leaves that often have a silvery or grayish underside. Its small, clustered flowers are typically white or pale yellow, and it produces small, oval berries that are edible but not particularly flavorful. Palicourea subalata is often found in humid, shaded environments such as rainforests and understorey habitats.
